Entries.DialogueText: Ah, you remembered the old mayor's birthday... what's this?
Um... well you know what they say, 'it's the thought that counts'.
Ah, you remembered the old mayor's birthday. That's very thoughtful of you. And it's a nice gift!
I've sampled many teas in my life, but none are quite so rare and special as this. Thanks!
*sniff*... *sniff*... Ah, I sense you've been spending some time in the old Community Center. It's good to know someone's taking care of the place.
Somehow, that old bridge to the quarry is now repaired.
I'm shocked... It must've taken a whole team to fix that thing!
Who could've done that?
, did you hear? It seems the old town bus started working again overnight!
That old thing has been dormant for decades... This is truly a great mystery.
I've never felt such an overwhelming pride in our community. You've done Pelican Town a great service, .
Hey, I was doing my nightly rounds, and noticed that your first parsnip was ready. Congratulations!
Those melons have been looking real good over at farm!
You know, that was one of your grandpa's favorite crops back in the day.
Nothing says 'Fall' quite like a pumpkin, don't you think?
The divorce paperwork is all squared away. Sorry that things didn't work out...
Another divorce? C'mon, ... you should be a little more careful who you decide to marry in the future...
Thank you . I won't forget this.
*sob* ... I can't believe you would do that...
You're terrible.
Do you have any bee houses on your farm?
If you place them near flowers you can get different types of honey.
Sometimes you can tell if there's something buried underground. Just keep your eyes open.
I hope things are going well for you on the farm.
Have you tried Gus' 'secret' spaghetti sauce?
...The ingredients may be secret, but the smell isn't.
I'll see you later.
Some of the townsfolk are wary of strangers. You'll have to win their trust before they open up to you.
Just be persistent and you'll get through to them.
Are you doing your best on the farm, ? You'll have to accomplish things in many areas if you want to become a well-rounded citizen.
The saloon gets pretty lively at night.
I like to visit once a week or so to catch up on things.
Hmmm... these strange little mushrooms have been popping up in my wood chips. I wonder what kind they are?Good morning! We're slowly entering the cold months, so I'm seeing my garden to a gentle end.
Ah, you're in town early, huh? Finished with your farm chores already?
It was around this time of year when I first became Mayor, over twenty years ago.
That makes me feel really old.
If you have any suggestions for the town, just drop a note into my suggestion box.
Oh, that's right... I don't have a suggestion box.
Every Wednesday I have buckwheat waffles and coffee for breakfast. It's a little tradition I observe to keep the bachelor life interesting.
I hope things are going well on farm. I'd hate to see it all dried up.
I just got off the phone with the Governor... Apparently this rain is supposed to be completely harmless. Just an unusual phenomenon of nature.
Still, some of the townsfolk are panicking, which is never good...
I guess we can expect these unusual rains every year. I think everyone is a little calmer knowing that it's just part of nature.
Well, that was quite the excitement for our little town! I'm just relieved that everyone is okay.
If this ever happens again, I think we'll all be a little more relaxed. It's not the end of the world!
So, how was your first night in the old cottage?
Your grandpa used to complain about the rickety old bed. But I think, deep down, he actually loved that house.
So, the old Community Center is gone... I guess times change, and good things come and go... Yet I can't help but feel a sense of loss.
I just hope this doesn't mar my record as Mayor.
Congratulations, . This is a big step forward for you and . You've really grown some roots in this town!
Congratulations once again, .
It's a good season to start thinking about gardening, even for us non-farmers.
The valley is known for producing some of the finest spring flowers!
All the young people seem happy about the new movie theater.
A thriving theater will be good for the local economy. I just hope there's nothing objectionable in those modern pictures!
, I heard what you did for Pam and Penny... now *that's* the kind of community support I love to see in Pelican Town!
, did you hear? Someone paid Robin to build Pam and Penny a house! Robin won't tell me who it was, though.
Regardless of who paid, I love seeing this kind of community support in Pelican Town!
I'm impressed, . You've really fixed up the place!
Hehe... Gus is really in his element.
Hehe... look at this place! I don't know how you did it, but this little vacation spot is the talk of the town.
Everyone aboard! We're heading back to the valley!
Vacation opportunities like this could really expand the local economy!
I'd better not stay in the sun too long, or my moustache will dry out.
Good evening! It's nice to see you socializing with the townsfolk.
It's good to stop by once in a while and see what the latest news is.
Hi, Gus!
Good evening, ! I'm glad to see you relaxing at the saloon. It's good for you to take a break now and then.
Your grandfather always worked himself too hard... I'll have an extra beer in his honor tonight.
Everyone seems a little happier on the weekends, don't you think?
I'm on the job seven days a week, though.
Ah... There's nothing like a strong cup of tea in the morning.
Have you planted any spring crops yet? The season doesn't last forever, you know.
Hmm... I wonder if it's anyone's birthday today? I'd better check the calendar by Pierre's shop.
Gardening is a hobby of mine, so I'm excited for this warm weather.
Say, are you growing any blueberries on your farm?
I do enjoy a fresh blueberry.:Lewis:258
I like to visit once a week or so to catch up on things. And to get a taste of Gus' authentic spaghetti.
Ah, my flowers are growing wonderfully!Good morning! Can you smell the sweet scent of these dew-lilies?
It's early but the air is already quite warm. Summer is nice for an old guy like me hehe.
How did I become Mayor in the first place? It's a long story.
We're both too busy for stories right now.
The moonlight jellies will be here soon. It's one of my favorite things about the valley.
I've been Mayor of Pelican Town for over twenty years!
No one ever runs against me when it's time for an election. I like to think that it means I'm doing my job well.
I like being Mayor.
The saloon can get pretty lively at night. Sometimes we even put a coin in the jukebox *chuckle*
I like to visit once a week or so to catch up on things, anyway.
You're in town early, huh? Finished with your farm chores already?
Good morning! I'm just checking on the garden as usual.Hmm... are these aphids?
Hmm... I hope these aren't scale bugs...
Just place anything you want to sell in the shipping box next to your house.
I'll be interested in seeing what kinds of things you put in there.
At the start of each season you'll have to remove the previous season's dead crops. It's easiest with a scythe.
Hmm... tax collection... *mumble* ...spring festivities expenses... *mumble*...
Yes?
*sniff*... *sniff*... can you smell that? I've been catching hints of fresh crab all day...
Well, winter is here! That means the townspeople will be spending most of their days indoors.
At least you'll know where to find them!
I've never been married. I have no family. All I live for is to be Mayor.
Is it worth it?
Another year is almost over!
I hope you had a productive year!
Hi there, ! How're you doing today?
If you see Marnie, tell her I say 'hi'.
I've got to start coming up with a plan for improving our town next year!
I'll still come by every night to collect your produce, even in the snow.
You still need to make money in the winter!
Congrats on winning that grange display competition.
Hehe... Just between you and me, I think Pierre needed a bowl of humble pudding!
Ah, the new farmer!
Welcome! I'm Lewis, Mayor of Pelican Town.
You know, everyone's been asking about you.
It's not every day that someone new moves in. It's quite a big deal!
So... You're moving into your grandfather's old cottage.
It's a good house... very 'rustic'.
Don't listen to her, . She's just trying to make you dissatisfied so that you buy one of her house upgrades.
Anyway... You must be tired from the long journey. You should get some rest.
Tomorrow you ought to explore the town a bit and introduce yourself.
The townspeople would appreciate that.
Oh, I almost forgot. If you have anything to sell, just place it in this box here. I'll come by during the night to collect it.
Well... Good luck!
Rude!
Oh my!
Why not...
Ah, hello there, .
I was just loading some more prizes into this machine here...
It's a new program I've come up with, to help promote a spirit of goodwill among the townsfolk... You included!
It's pretty simple... sometimes, when you help out others in town, you'll receive a 'Prize Ticket'. You can turn them in for rewards.
There's some special stuff in there!
My only worry is that people will just go after the tickets, rather than cultivating a true compassion for their fellow man...
At any rate... keep checking the 'Help Wanted' board in town. That's a good way to get your hands on more tickets.
Good luck out there.
Is that so? Well, I'm glad to hear that!
I see!
Well... that's not what I hoped to hear, but I appreciate the honesty.
Mmph..
Ah, hello there, . You showed up at the perfect time.
It's our new 'Special Orders' board.
Robin and I built it from scratch.
*Ahem*... Ignore her.
Now, let me explain...
You see... with Farm back in business, the local economy has really been picking up.
As a result, some of the local townsfolk have been asking me for a way to source local ingredients for their businesses or personal projects.
So, Robin and I came up with the idea of a new 'Special Orders' board, where people can post bigger jobs than would make sense for the old billboard outside Pierre's.
*groan*

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Town/191393/Hn ccFishTank/Hn ccBulletin/Hn ccPantry/Hn ccVault/Hn ccBoilerRoom/Hn ccCraftsRoom/Hl jojaFishTank/Hl jojaPantry/Hl jojaVault/Hl jojaBoilerRoom/Hl jojaCraftsRoom/Hl JojaMember/w sunny/H
Entries.DialogueText: I'm not sure how you did it, ... but the community center has never looked better!

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Town/191393/Hn ccFishTank/Hn ccBulletin/Hn ccPantry/Hn ccVault/Hn ccBoilerRoom/Hn ccCraftsRoom/Hl jojaFishTank/Hl jojaPantry/Hl jojaVault/Hl jojaBoilerRoom/Hl jojaCraftsRoom/Hl JojaMember/w sunny/H_1
Entries.DialogueText: You've done Pelican Town a great service. Everyone in town is pleased.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Town/191393/Hn ccFishTank/Hn ccBulletin/Hn ccPantry/Hn ccVault/Hn ccBoilerRoom/Hn ccCraftsRoom/Hl jojaFishTank/Hl jojaPantry/Hl jojaVault/Hl jojaBoilerRoom/Hl jojaCraftsRoom/Hl JojaMember/w sunny/H_1
Entries.DialogueText: As a way of saying 'Thank You', I'd like to present you with this Town's greatest honor... The Stardew Hero Award. You've earned it!

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Town/191393/Hn ccFishTank/Hn ccBulletin/Hn ccPantry/Hn ccVault/Hn ccBoilerRoom/Hn ccCraftsRoom/Hl jojaFishTank/Hl jojaPantry/Hl jojaVault/Hl jojaBoilerRoom/Hl jojaCraftsRoom/Hl JojaMember/w sunny/H_alt
Entries.DialogueText: VOICE: Grumble... Grumble...

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Town/191393/Hn ccFishTank/Hn ccBulletin/Hn ccPantry/Hn ccVault/Hn ccBoilerRoom/Hn ccCraftsRoom/Hl jojaFishTank/Hl jojaPantry/Hl jojaVault/Hl jojaBoilerRoom/Hl jojaCraftsRoom/Hl JojaMember/w sunny/H_alt_1
Entries.DialogueText: Who's that?

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Town/191393/Hn ccFishTank/Hn ccBulletin/Hn ccPantry/Hn ccVault/Hn ccBoilerRoom/Hn ccCraftsRoom/Hl jojaFishTank/Hl jojaPantry/Hl jojaVault/Hl jojaBoilerRoom/Hl jojaCraftsRoom/Hl JojaMember/w sunny/H_alt_2
Entries.DialogueText: Ah, Morris.
Hey! What do you think you're doing? That's private property!
*sigh*... The youth these days... Sometimes I wonder if this town isn't doomed.
You saw what happened, . What do you have to say about this?
Sam!
Don't blame Sam. There's nowhere else for him to ride!#I'm staying out of this.
Fine! I just won't ride my skateboard ever again. Happy?~Exactly! If there was a park in town, I could ride there and everyone would be happy.~Hmmph. Alright.

You're being difficult, Sam. I have no problem with you riding around town, just try not to cause any damage! It's that simple.~Hmmph. I thought you were more mature than this, .~I'll let it slide this time, Sam. But I don't want to see you doing this anymore.
Got it?~Sam... I'm sorry I yelled at you. Just please try not to damage anything in the future. Got it?~Got it?
I'm proud of you, Leah! Events like this really breathe life into our little town!
Now let's start the bidding on these wonderful art pieces... A marvelous addition to your home!
Do I hear 5000g for the pink one?
Wow! I'm exhausted.
My show was a real success, wasn't it?
Oh, hi there.
What an eyesore...
What?
What's the matter? Are you ill?
You saw something? Hmm... I wouldn't be surprised if this place was full of rats.
You're worrying me, ...
Look, I think I'm going to head home. I need some lunch.
Hey. I'll keep this place unlocked from now on... maybe you can help catch that rat if you have some extra time.
This is the Pelican Town Community Center... or what's left of it, anyway.
It used to be the pride and joy of the town... always bustling with activity.
Now... just look at it. It's shameful.
These days, the young folk would rather sit in front of the TV than engage with the community.
But listen to me, I sound like an old fool.
Joja Corporation has been hounding me to sell them the land so they can turn it into a warehouse...
Pelican Town could use the money, but there's something stopping me from selling it... I guess old timers like me get attached to relics of the past... Ah well.
If anyone else buys a Joja Co. Membership I'm just gonna go ahead and sell it.
*sigh*... Here, let's go inside...
Hmm? What's this?...
I guess Vincent and Jas must've been playing in here.
This place is even more dilapidated than I remember.
Strange...
I'll have to come back and explore this building further.
Marnie... we can't. If word got out, it could undermine my position of authority in the town!
You understand... don't you?
200 null 200 50 event_secret1 201 -100 event_secret2#Yes... and I'm going to tell everyone.
Wow... Look at that view.
You know, ... I've been mayor of Pelican Town for a long time.
People have come and gone. We've lived through times of hardship, and times of plenty.
But I have to say, in all the years I've been mayor, nothing has made me so proud as seeing Farm blossom under your care.
You've taken the farm beyond the wildest dreams of your Grandfather.
And in the process, you've changed the valley forever.
You might not realize it, but I care a lot about this town, .
years ago, I was deeply worried about the future of the valley.
But now, I feel completely at ease.
Who knew a humble farmer moving to town would change everything?
...Thank you.

Well , it's the big day... Our most important festival of the year, the 'Stardew Valley Fair'.If you'd like to participate by setting up a grange display, I've left an empty stand for you. Just let me know after you've set everything up so we can get to the judging.

Greetings, ! The 'Stardew Valley Fair' is finally here and the crowd is growing by the minute.Just like last year, I've set up an empty grange display for you. Speak with me when you're ready to commence the judging.
Good evening, . Have you ventured into the haunted maze yet? It's quite spooky.That strange man who lives in the tower set it all up himself. He wouldn't let anyone near while he was working on it.

Good evening, . Once again, we've been graced with a haunted maze, constructed in secret by the eccentric who lives out in the forest.I've heard it's larger this year. Good luck if you dare to venture inside...
Wow, look at all these eggs!Now if only I could get you kids to pick up litter this efficiently, we'd have the cleanest town this side of the Gem Sea! *chuckle*
And now, the winner of this year's egg hunt...
Here's your prize! Enjoy.
Well, that's it for this year's Egg Festival. Thanks for coming, everyone!
It's time for the highlight of today's festivities... The Annual Spring Egg Hunt!
Calm down now, kiddos. You're going to need all your energy if you hope to find the most eggs and take home the exclusive prize.
Now... Is everyone ready?
Let the egg hunt begin!
Enjoying yourself, ?
Here's your prize, Abigail. Enjoy!
If you'd like to dance with the other young people, you'll need to find a partner.
Good afternoon, . The weather for today's festivities couldn't be more perfect.Come talk to me when you're ready to start the ceremony.
Well folks, it's time once again for the potluck ceremony.I trust that you all put high-quality ingredients in the pot this year. We don't want the governor to regret his visit to the valley!
Well... Governor? Would you do us the honor of tasting the soup?
Now... who else wants some soup?
He's right... It's nothing special. Not bad, though.
Well... who else wants some soup?
Yuck. Someone must have ruined it with a poor-quality ingredient.
Well... does anyone want any?
Good going, people... Whoever put that foul ingredient in the soup made the Governor pass out! I'm ashamed.
Go home, the festival is over.

Hello and welcome, everyone! I'm pleased to announce that the potluck ceremony has begun.I have high hopes that you all contributed high-quality ingredients! We want to leave the governor with a good impression, now.
Well... Governor? Would you indulge us with an honorary first tasting?
Look sharp! The governor's here for his annual visit.If you brought something for the potluck make sure and add it to the soup cauldron.

Whoever took part in this appalling act is truly reprehensible. Using my very private item for this sick purpose!And to ruin a perfectly good soup... unforgivable! I've never been more ashamed of this community... Truly disgusting.
The governor is our distinguished guest today! I expect all of you to be on your best behavior.For those who brought something for the potluck, contribute your ingredients to the soup cauldron.
You're right... It's a little bland.
Well, thanks for joining us this year, Governor. Sorry the soup wasn't anything special.
You're right... It's delicious!
Wonderful job, everyone! Now... who else wants a taste?
Mmm... tasty. You all did very well today.
Good evening, . The Moonlight Jellies are close... I already saw one glowing in the distance.Once we launch the candle-boat they'll come up to the docks and say hello.
Greetings, . As the evening sets in, the Moonlight Jellies draw closer to the shoreline.Once we set the candle-boat on its way, they'll gather around the docks.
Today is a time to be thankful for this year's good fortune. Forget your worries for a day and relax!
Happy Feast Of The Winter Star, .This is a time to unwind, enjoy good company, and express gratitude for all that we have.
Alright, everyone. Let's begin this year's ice fishing competition.
Contestants, your goal is to catch as many fish as you possibly can in two minutes using the provided fishing rods.You must catch your fish here, from these holes in the ice.
Well, that's it for this year's Festival of Ice. Thanks for coming, everyone!Now let's release these poor fish...

Welcome to the Festival of Ice!The highlight of today's festival is the ice fishing competition. We set up this 'frozen lake' and stocked it full of fish.Just let me know when you're ready to compete.
Contestants, with the provided fishing rods you must catch as many fish as you can from these holes in the ice.
Are you all ready?
Begin!
Impressive, that's a lot of caught fish!
*gag*... I will never get used to that stench...
Now, for the winner of this year's ice fishing competition...
Well, is everyone ready?
Here's your prize, Willy. Enjoy.
Hello, . It's that time of the year again for the ice fishing festival.Speak with me when you're ready to start the competition!
Wow, that's a lot of fish!
*gag*... the smell...
Well, that's it for this year's Festival of Ice. Thanks for coming, everyone! Now let's release these poor fish...
Wow, this is my favorite! Thank you!
Thanks, this is great!
Well, I guess it's the thought that counts...
This makes me sick. What a horrendous gift.
That's very nice of you. Thanks.
